description.p: A blast of ice forming a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The icy blast freezes any liquids in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

You focus on a target or point within range and cause an eruption of jagged ice crystals to form in all directions instantaneously. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Any non-magical fires are snuffed out in the area of effect which becomes difficult terrain till the end of the next turn at which point the magical ice evaporates.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

setters.set: A diamond worth at least 25 gp

description.p: A vertical column of spiders begins to rain down in a location you specify. Each creature that starts its turn within the 20-foot radius, 40-foot high cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. A Swarm of Spiders (Monster Manual, pg 334) descends onto each creature within the cylinder. On a failed saving throw, this swarm has full hit points (22). On a successful save, this swarm has half hit points (11).

This swarm is considered to be climbing on the target creature and moves with them, even if they leave the affected area, and takes its turn immediately after that creature’s turn. A creature can make use of its action to attempt to get them off, making a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check against the spell save DC of the caster.

If a creature is already swarmed by spiders starts their turn in the area of effect, they repeat the saving throw. The swarm on that creature gains 22 current and maximum hit points on a failed save, and 11 current and maximum hitpoints on a success save. The swarm’s hit points cannot go above 22 for a medium creature, 44 for a large or larger creature.
Any spiders that remain when the spell ends disappear after 1d4 rounds.

The first time you hit with a weapon attack during this spell’s duration, frost spreads across the target, and the attack deals an extra 2d6 cold damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or its speed is halved until the spell ends.
A creature slowed by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

The first time you hit with a weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your weapon flashes with electric arcs, and the attack deals an extra 2d6 lightning damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or it can’t take reactions until the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

element.name: Poisoning Strike
element.supports: Artificer, Bard, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard, Warlock, Witch

description.p: The first time you hit with a weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your attack deals an extra 1d6 poison damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

element.name: Jaunting Strike
element.supports: Artificer, Bard, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard, Warlock

description.p: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your attack deals an extra 2d6 force damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice within 15 feet of the target that you can see. When the target teleports, you can also choose to teleport with it, to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of its destination.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

element.name: Disappearing Strike
element.supports: Artificer, Bard, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard, Warlock

description.p: The first time you hit with a weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your weapon fades from sight, and the attack deals an extra 3d8 force damage to the target. Additionally after hitting the target, at the end of your turn, you become invisible until the spell ends, or until you attack or cast a spell.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your weapon draws the life force from its target into you, and the attack deals an extra 4d6 necrotic damage to the target. Additionally, you gain 3d6 temporary hitpoints.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage and temporary hitpoints each increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration, arcane energy crackles around your weapon, and the attack deals an extra 4d8 force damage to the target. If the target is concentrating on a spell, it has disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain its concentration due to the force damage. If the target loses concentration on a spell due to the attack, it takes additional force damage equal to 1d8 per level of the spell.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increase by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your weapon pulses with green light, and the attack deals an extra 6d10 force damage to the target and causes it to begin to disintegrate. At the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 3d10 force damage. On a successful save, the spell ends. The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

You magically charge at a creature within range, teleporting to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away from you and knocked prone. The shield used to cast the spell reverberates with a temporary magical barrier after completing the charge, granting you a +2 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn.

You throw the shield used to cast the spell, and it bounces between creatures of your choice. Choose an initial target within range, then three additional targets. Each additional target must be within 15 feet of another chosen target. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 bludgeoning damage. The shield returns to you after casting the spell, and you can immediately don it (no action required).

The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your attack deals an extra 2d6 psychic damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you for the duration.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

The first time you hit with a weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your attack deals an extra 3d8 force damage to the target, and the next attack roll made against this target before the spell ends has advantage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

You inscribe a magical rune on the armor used as part of casting this spell. If the armor is not being worn or carried, the armor comes to life as an Animated Armor under your control. If the animated armor falls to 0 hitpoints, the spell ends.

setters.set: 100gp worth of crystalline chalk which is consumed, and plate armor that is not being worn worth at least 1500gp

description.p: You momentarily heighten a creature’s sense of pain. The target makes an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target feels increased pain until the start of your next turn. The first time it takes damage during the spell’s duration, the target also takes 1d8 psychic damage. This damage increases to 1d12 if the damage taken is psychic damage.
The spell’s damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level (2d8 or 2d12), 11th level (3d8 or 3d12), and 17th level (4d8 or 4d12).

Touch a pile of at least 10 corpses of Rats that died within the last week. Your spell imbues the targets with a foul mimicry of life, raising them as an undead swarm. The targets become a swarm of zombie rats. The swarm uses the statistics of a Swarm of Rats, but has half as many hitpoints, as well as immunity to poison damage and the poisoned condition. If the pile of corpses has at least 20 rats in it, the swarm comes to life with its regular amount of hitpoints.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command the swarm if its within 60 feet of you. You decide what action the swarm will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the swarm only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the swarm continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The swarm is under your control for the duration of the spell, after which it reverts to a pile of lifeless corpses, which can be reused for this spell. If the swarm is reduced to half hitpoints, only half of the corpses can be reused, if the rat swarm is reduced to 0 hitpoints, none of the corpses can be reused.

You utter a word of power that makes a humanoid you can see within range realize that there was a skeleton inside them the whole time. If the creature you chose has 75 hitpoints or fewer, its skeleton is removed from its body, and it dies. If the target dies, each humanoid within 60 feet of it that can see it becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. Otherwise, the spell has no effect other than to make the target frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

If you kill a humanoid with this spell, its removed skeleton becomes an undead Skeleton under your command, until it is reduced to 0 hitpoints. On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command the skeleton if its within 60 feet of you. You decide what action the skeleton will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the skeleton only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the skeleton continues to follow it until its task is complete.
You magically fold and animate a Tiny piece of paper or similar material, such as a leaf, within range. You can fold it into one of the following shapes:

Boat. The boat floats on and is not destroyed by water. When placed in water, you can mentally direct the boat to move in any direction along the water’s surface, at a speed of 5 feet per round. The boat is able to carry a single Tiny object that weighs 1 pound or less.

Crane. The crane has a fly speed of 10 feet. You can mentally direct the crane to move, or name a location within 1 mile that you know of. The crane will fly to the location and land, becoming nonmagical and inert.

Dog. The dog has a movement speed of 10 feet. You can mentally direct the dog to move. If a creature hostile to you moves to within 10 feet of the dog, the dog moves up to its speed towards it and gives off a loud barking noise. Afterwards, the dog unfolds itself and becomes nonmagical and inert.
Flower. The flower is controlled by the time of day. It is open during the day and closed during the night. During sunrise and sunset, the flower slowly opens and closes respectively.
Samurai. The samurai has a movement speed of 5 feet. You can mentally direct the samurai to move. The samurai always points his sword in the direction of the nearest castle or fort.

As an action, you can fold another piece of paper into a shape of your choice, or unfold an origami shape back into a nonmagical piece of paper. You can have up to five pieces of origami active at once using this spell.

You cast a sparkling ball of light to a point within range, where it then shoots up 60 feet into the sky. Until the spell ends, the flare sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. You can choose the color of the light upon casting the spell, and can change it as a bonus action during the spell’s duration.
The flare descends 5 feet at the start of each of your turns for the duration. If the flare touchs a creature, an object, or the ground, the spell immediately ends.

You warp and shape the landscape and climate of an area up to 1 mile square, transforming it into the type of terrain you desire. As part of casting the spell, you choose a type of terrain such as arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, or swamp, along with any number of specific features such as rivers, hills, certain plants and animals, or specific variations of the terrain. You can lay out what you’d like the region to be like in detail, but you lack precise control over the exact layout of the resulting geography. You can also select any number of structures or locations within the area to exclude, sparing them from the destructive process that this spell entails. The changes occur over the course of 1 hour after casting the spell.

During the terraforming, the land is ravaged by the magical forces you have wrought. The geography is physically torn asunder, splitting into ravines, rising into mountains, being reshaped into the type of terrain that you specified. Forests can wither and disintegrate into deserts, or mountains can turn from rock to ice, forming mighty glaciers.

The climate is modified to allow for your desired terrain, regardless of the previous or surrounding climatology. These changes are provided with physical means of occurring within the terrain, for example, to warm the region, hot geysers or lava flows may form, or to cool the region, streams of ice may flow through the area. Wind and clouds spontaneously form or are dispersed within the region in order to match the required climate.

Plants within the region are formed, and rapidly grow to a mixture of stages of life, as if the region had been this way for centuries. Any existing plants in the area are destroyed and their biomatter re-used to create the new plants. Any existing creatures in the area will most likely be killed by tectonic upheaval if they remain, taking 5d12 bludgeoning damage for every minute they spend in the region, and animals within the area instinctually flee en-masse once the spell is cast. This spell does not create new animal life in the region, but animals within 10 miles that can thrive in the terrain are drawn to it, causing it to become rapidly populated with the appropiate types and amounts of creatures within 7 days, if they’re available.

Any structures within the region that you did not exclude from the spell are sundered by titanic forces, suffering 50 bludgeoning damage at the start of each of your turns for the 1 hour duration of the terraforming. If a structure drops to 0 hitpoints, it collapses and is disintegrated into dust, which is re-used in the terraforming process. If a non-excluded structure somehow survives the process, it is merely incorporated into the terrain, such as being overgrown with native plants or becoming half-buried in sand, instead of being destroyed. Any structure that you excluded from the spell is spared the destruction, though any plants or creatures within may find the new terrain inhospitable.

The climate of the region is magically enforced, but once the process is complete, the region behaves as natural terrain, and can be disrupted by events such as fires, animal migrations, earthquakes, or other physical phenomena, natural or artificial. If you cast this spell on a plane or world other than your native one, you can only specify terrain types and features that occur on your native plane or world. The region still obeys the physics of whatever plane it exists in, so attempting to break the physics of a plane, such as creating floating islands on the material, or forming a glacier in the plane of fire, will end poorly, such as the glacier melting, or the floating islands crashing to the ground.

The spell can be disrupted by dispel magic during the 1 hour terraforming process, but once that time has elapsed, only another terraform spell or the power of the wish spell can return the region to its original state.

setters.set: a mixture of bonemeal, diamond dust, and soil from the desired terrain type worth at least 10,000gp

description.p: Divine judgment sends your foes sprawling to the ground. Each creature of your choice within range must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 radiant damage and is slammed into the ground, falling prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage, and is not knocked prone.

You speak poisonous words that magically demoralize a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 2d10 poison damage as boils and blisters cover its flesh, and it has disadvantage on Charisma checks and saving throws for the duration of the spell.
This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. A lesser restoration or greater restoration spell ends the effect.

An aura of invisibility emanates from with a radius of 10 feet for the duration. You and each creature of your choice within the radius immediately becomes invisible when you cast the spell. When a friendly creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it becomes invisible.
An affected creature becomes visible if they attack, cast a spell, force a creature to make a saving throw, or move out of the radius.
The spell ends if you attack, cast a spell, force a creature to make a saving throw, or move more than 15 feet in a turn.

setters.set: a small prism worth at least 100gp

description.p: You bless a willing creature you touch with divine endurance. The target gains 3d8+6 temporary hitpoints for the duration.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the temporary hitpoints increase by 6 for each slot level above 3rd.

setters.set: a vial of holy water worth at least 25gp, which the spell consumes

description.p: You summon the Chariot of Sustarre from the elemental plane of fire, appearing with a clap of thunder amid a cloud of roiling smoke and fire in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. The chariot is a Huge vehicle decorated with a sunburst motif and drawn by two elemental horses of flame.

For the duration, the chariot follows your verbal commands on your turn. The flaming steeds take no actions, but move as you direct them, pulling the chariot with a speed of 60 feet and a fly speed of 120 feet. The chariot and its steeds are immune to all damage.

The chariot emanates an aura of fire within 10 feet of it. When you cast this spell, you can designate up to 7 other creatures you can see to be undamaged by the chariot. When any other creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 fire damage, or half as much damage on a success.

When the spell ends, the chariot and its steeds return to the plane of fire, leaving its passengers and anything else inside behind. A divine word or a banishment spell that affects both steeds ends the spell.

setters.set: a small piece of wood and two holly berries worth at least 1sp, which must be consumed in a campfire

description.p: Choose up to 8 other creatures within range. You and the chosen creatures gain the ability to speak and understand the magical language of Foolspeech for the duration. Other creatures can’t understand the language, unless they are also under the effects of a foolspeech spell.

Foolspeech sounds like shifting, whistling tones, unrecognizable as a language at all to outside observers, and can’t be learned outside the use of this spell. A comprehend languages or tongues spell does not impart understanding of Foolspeech.
Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against cantrips. The creature can’t be affected by cantrips unless it wishes to be.

You impose a sense of impending doom upon a creature of your choice within range. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, they take 1d10 psychic damage and are cursed for the duration. Whenever the cursed creature fails an ability check or saving throw, or misses with an attack, it takes 1d10 psychic damage.
A remove curse spell ends this effect.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.
You touch a willing creature and cause their skin to soak up the sun’s energy for the duration. When the affected creature starts its turn in sunlight, it regains 2d6 hitpoints.

Choose a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range, or the gravestone of one. Your spell summons forth a portion of its spirit to act as your servant, becoming a Specter (the DM has the creature’s game statistics).

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you. You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.
If the specter is reduced to 0 hitpoints, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the specter vanishes.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the specter is created with 8 additional hitpoints for each slot level above 4th.

setters.set: a holy symbol that has been defaced and soaked in blood)

description.p: You transfigure a wooden stick at least 2 feet long into a snake under your control. Roll a d4 to determine the type of snake:
A snake reverts into a nonmagical stick when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The snake is friendly to you and your companions, acting on your initiative. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The DM has the creatures’ statistics.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can transfigure one additional stick into a snake for each slot level above 1st. Roll a d4 separately to determine each snake’s type.

element.name: Starlight
element.supports: Artificer, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard, Witch

description.p: A small shining star appears in a point you choose within range, which sheds dim light in a 300-foot radius.

If you chose a point on an object you are holding or one that isn’t being worn or carried, the light shines from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the affected object with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the light.

A cloud of glittering multicolored particles fill the air in a 20-foot cube within range for the duration. Each object and creature in the area is unavoidable covered in the glitter, and can’t benefit from being invisible for the duration. If a creature enters the area, it is also immediately covered in the glitter.

Additionally, when a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is blinded for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, a blinded target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, it is no longer blinded.

You briefly become one with civilization and gain knowledge of the surrounding territory. In a civilized area, the spell gives you knowledge of the area within 3 miles of you. The spell doesn’t function in the wilderness, requiring notable levels of construction and civilization in the area.
You instantly gain knowledge of up to three facts of your choice about any of the following subjects as they relate to the area:
For example, you could determine the fastest route to the city center, the most prevalent race amongst the population, and the location of any blacksmiths in the area.

You imbue the gemstone used for this spell with radiant energy, and hurl it at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 8d8 radiant damage, and is blinded until the end of your next turn.

Hit or miss, the gems then explodes. The target and each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 4d8 radiant damage and be blinded until the end of your next turn.
If a target of the spell is an undead or a fiend, it takes an extra 4d8 radiant damage from both the attack and the explosion.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the initial and explosion damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 6th.

setters.set: a topaz gemstone worth at least 500gp which the spell consumes

description.p: When you cast this spell, one of your hands is enveloped in searing flame. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 fire damage, and the flame from your hand jumps to the target, surrounding it in an aura of intense heat with a radius of 5 feet. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d6 fire damage, or half as much damage on a success. These magical flames can’t be extinguished by nonmagical means.
Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as an action.

Alternatively when you make the attack, you can touch an object that isn’t being worn or carried, transferring the flame to it and imparting the same aura of intense heat to the target until the spell ends.
If damage from this spell kills a target, the target is turned to ash. An affected target sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the attack’s damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 7th.

Sharpened stalks of bamboo burst from the ground in a 15-foot square within range. Each creature in the area when the bamboo appears must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 3d6 piercing damage and is restrained until the end of your next turn, or it uses an action to escape.
The bamboo remains after the spell is cast, turning the area into difficult terrain.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

You create five sandstone tablets carved with hieroglyphs in your space. They float in the air and orbit you for the spell’s duration. When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to expend one of the tablets, causing the attack to instead miss you and destroy the tablet.

When you cast the spell — and as a bonus action on each of your turns thereafter — you can expend one of the tablets, launching it at a target of your choice within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 3d12 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone.
When all the tablets are expended, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the number of tablets created increases by one for each slot level above 7th.

setters.set: a golden staff adorned with a jackal worth at least 500gp

description.p: Magical ropes appear and entangle a creature of your choice within range. The target must make a Strength saving throw, becoming restrained on a failed save. A creature restrained by the ropes can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
When the spell ends, the ropes disappear.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

Two creatures of your choice within range that can see eachother must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes charmed by the other target of the spell, becoming obsessed with staying by their side. A charmed creature can’t willingly move away from the other creature, and must use its movement on its turns to move towards the target of their infatuation, getting as close as is possible without harming itself. If grappled, restrained, or otherwise prevented from moving, the charmed creature has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to escape.

This spell places a magical mark on a willing creature, so that they may be found if lost. For the duration, you have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Survival) check you make to find the marked creature. As an action, you can determine the distance and direction to the marked creature, as long as they are on the same plane of existence as you.
If the marked creature is reduced to 0 hitpoints, you immediately receive a mental alarm and feeling of danger. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.

At Higher Levels. The spell’s duration increases when you cast it using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher: 8 Hours with a 2nd level slot, 24 hours with a 3rd level slot, 7 days with a 4th level slot, 30 days with a 5th level slot, 1 year with a 6th level slot. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled.
